PreparerFirmName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: C DeWitt Foard & Co PA CPAs

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To provide life-skills for homeless, chemically dependent adults and families within a supportive, residential environment, leading to their independence.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To provide life-skills for homeless, chemically dependent adults and families within a supportive, residential environment, leading to their independence.
IRS990.Desc: Clinical Program: 295 adults and 18 children received residential substance abuse services. 54% of those who exited the program (169) went into permanent housing. 90% of the adults served had 3+ co-occuring disorders, primarily mental health and chronic health diagnoses.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Vocational: Of the 217 participants, 97% were unemployed at entry. 59% completed the vocational training program, and 83% increasing their income, averaging $1,763.95 per month or $11.03 per hour. Percent improved over last year 20%

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Each member of the finance committee to review and approve before filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Procedure is for staff and board to review the policies annually and sign a statement that it was reviewed. If there is a breach of conflict by staff, it is addressed in a meeting with that person's supervisor, our Personnel VP and our CEO, and minutes are taken and kept in that employee's file as to the outcome and steps to be taken. If there is a breach with the Board, the steps are outlined in the Conflict of Interest Policy.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CEO's performance is reviewed by the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Performance of all other employees reviewed by CEO.
